title: Alsenborn
text:
Alsenborn is a village forming part of the municipality of <a href="Enkenbach-Alsenborn">Enkenbach-Alsenborn</a> within the <a href="Kaiserslautern%20%28district%29">district of Kaiserslautern</a> in the German state of <a href="Rhineland-Palatinate">Rhineland-Palatinate</a>. It has a population of 2,750. Until 1969 Alsenborn was an independent parish before merging with Enkenbach under the administrative reforms in the state. Alsenborn is known country-wide for its circus troupes, the football team of <a href="SV%20Alsenborn">SV Alsenborn</a>, which competed for promotion to the <a href="Bundesliga">premier league</a> in 1970, and as the home town of <a href="Fritz%20Walter">Fritz Walter</a>, the 1954 captain of the German Football Team and World Cup champions.
Geography and Geology.
Alsenborn lies 12 kilometres northeast of the city of <a href="Kaiserslautern">Kaiserslautern</a>, by the <a href="Stumpfwald">Stumpfwald</a>, a part of the <a href="Palatine%20Forest">Palatine Forest</a>.
Alsenborn developed as a "<a href="Haufendorf">Haufendorf</a>" within the Alsenborn Basin and has grown westwards to merge with the neighbouring village of <a href="Enkenbach">Enkenbach</a>. Its residential areas have developed predominantly along the road through the valley.
